One of my favorites.  GLaDOS makes the game fun everytime.

Very fun fps/puzzle game. My only criticism's that by the time you've about mastered the controls and movement, the game's about near the finish line.

It's a must-play for anyone who likes puzzle games, fps or Valve's other titles.
Really fun mechanics and the story is incredible, just buy it if you havent yet, IT IS WORTH IT!!!!!!
One of the best games I've played yet.

I'm generally not a fan of puzzle games, yet Portal is one of the most engaging and amusing games I have ever played, even over a decade after its release. If I were making a list of "must-play" games this would easily be one of the first games I would name.
the cake was not a lie
You can't beat the classics. Good story, great sense of humor, and good puzzles that aren't insanely hard. (though there are advanced maps if you want that) Still holds up today.
I recently played Portal for the first time and it was really fun. The puzzles were interesting and Glados was a cool villian. Its a short game but still very fun
Some Parts Maybe Hard But This Game Is Fun And Other Everyone In The World Should Play It

Having played the games in the wrong order (I played Portal 2 first), I was a bit disappointed by this game - but I had to keep reminding myself that this was a couple of years older than the game I love.
Very short, but still good - and if nothing else, you get the back story for the second game, even if it's a bit convoluted.
Still worth playing though, and the bonus features make this well worth the money.

are you fucking kidding me i haven't written a review for this game yet? of course i recommend it
this game put me on a path for the rest of my life of some of the best video game experiences i have ever had. this game isn't that long, if you haven't played it, absolutely do so. and if you have a bit of extra time, get the bundle with both games and play both of them.
also i only have so many hours in this game because of 100%ing it and also steam counts all mods of the game as the game itself for playtime. so, all the time in portal beta mods and portal prelude and everything else, all counts
very good story and good game play mechanics

only puzzle game I did without a walkthrough, first playthrough completely blind. makes me feel like I can write an AI of myself now.

I love this game more than the second game, for one reason is it's atmosphere of making you feel alone, and two for how its soundtrack gives the senses of dread as you go through each chamber. The puzzles in this game are all unique and/or can be challenging near the end. I'm might be a bit nostalgic for the early source textures and look since it plays well with the lighting.
this is my favourite game on steam
it is pretty fun, and the boss fight is fun. It is kinda short though, only taking a few hours to beat for the first time.

Honestly can't recommend this for $10. The game spends much of its time slowly introducing new mechanics but they only amount to a few somewhat difficult levels towards the end. Emphasis on somewhat, this game sets a precedent for Portal 2 more than anything. You're better off skipping it.
